{"step_by_step_thinking": "If an affected male does not have affected children, it suggests that the condition is not passed on through the father. If an affected female always has affected children, it suggests that the condition is always passed on from the mother. This pattern of inheritance is consistent with X linked dominant inheritance, where affected females pass on the condition to all of their children, while affected males do not pass on the condition to any of their children.", "answer_choice": "C. X linked dominant"}
